Let me introduce myself!

I recently graduated from Barnard College with a B.A. in Computer Science, accompanied by a minor in English Literature. I am passionate about how society can use tech for good, and am currently searching for jobs that I believe would help me make a positive impact.
At Barnard I was able to take a very diverse course load, ranging from Building Usable Security where I worked with a team to create an iOS app to help people store documents to Computational Sound where I learned the art of live coding music, using Sonic Pi. Of course, I also honed my skills in languages such as Python, C, Java, HTML, R, etc.
Last summer I gained valuable experience, interning at the Statue of Liberty-Ellis Island Foundation where I served as a Software Development Intern. I gained experience managing tickets in Jira, creating clear documentation, and writing SQL queries to access important information. Most significantly, I worked on a SalesForce migration, conducting important testing.
During my time in college, I also gained experience working for both WKCR and WBAR . I love to connect with people, and I believe music is the perfect way to do that.
